properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 5 at 11:39AM PST until January 6 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW THROUGH MONDAY IN THE CASCADE MOUNTAINS...

.Several rounds of moderate to heavy snow will impact the Cascade
Crest this week. Snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches are expected
at Stevens Pass through tonight. An additional 1 to 2 feet of snow
will occur Monday into Monday evening with snowfall rates up to 3
inches per hour making for potentially dangerous conditions at
Stevens Pass. If you have plans to travel over the Cascade Passes
the next several days, monitor road reports closely.

* WHAT...8 to 12 inches of mountain snow expected this afternoon
through tonight. An additional 1 to 2 feet of heavy wet snow
expected in the mountains Monday and Monday evening.

* WHERE...The Cascade Crest including Highway 2 from Coles
Corner to Stevens Pass.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, through 4 AM PST Monday.
For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM to 10 PM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected today and
tonight with periods of moderate to heavy mountain snow.
Increasingly heavy snow will have the potential to produce
dangerous conditions Monday into Monday evening with snowfall
rates up to 3 inches per hour.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Valley snow accumulations of 5 to 10
inches are expected on Monday for upper portions of the
Wenatchee River Valley and the upper Methow Valley including
Plain, Lake Wenatchee, and Mazama.
properties.instruction:
The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1. If you must travel on Monday, keep
an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of
an emergency.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 PM PST MONDAY FOR THE CASCADE CREST INCLUDING HIGHWAY 2 BETWEEN COLES CORNER AND STEVENS PASS
